content.description: The first 1/2 (crux section) climbs the face between Executioner’s Song and Bizarro World avoiding the Bizarro World arêtes and the left wall of Executioner's.  Once you gain the jugs just left of the low end of the left arête on Bizarro World, the crux is over and you can head on up and finish on the second 1/2 of Bizarro World.
A short climb on the most up river section of the Dihedrals.  Start in the bottom slab and go up through the large notch in the small roof.  Follow cracks all the way to the top.
content.protection: Top rope off typical Great Falls anchors.
content.location: Go as far up river as you can on the Dihedrals section.  Take Five, Skink, and Overhead Smash are on this face.  It faces up river unlike most of the other climbs here.  There is a 5.1 down climb just to the left (from up top).  These climbs are isolated from the rest of the climbs at the Dihedrals.

content.description: Start on the right wall of an upstream facing corner, 20 feet upstream from the start of Die-Hedral - climb the left slanting crack until it is possible to move up right below overhang.  Pull the overhang to gain the large ledge. The "second pitch" ascends the left wall of the Crypt between the corner and the incipient crack.
content.location: 20 feet upstream from the start of Die-Hedral.

content.description: Start 15 feet downstream from the plaque, below a dihedral with a large overhang at its top - climb the easy corner to the overhang. Pull the overhang at the thin crack.
content.location: 15 feet downstream of the plaque

content.description: a slab climb folloing a thin seam with a overhang on it. Crux is getting over the overhang
content.location: The most up stream route in the Dihedrals area.

content.description: Climb the right-facing dihedral just left of Executioner's song. When the first dihedral ends slope up and right into a second dihedral and continue to the top.
content.location: This is the first dihedral after the broken crack that splits the face of the Dihedrals area - about 20 yards upstream from the plaque. The start is a few feet downstream from Executioner's Song.

content.description: Hand crack up a shallow dihedral about 10 yards upstream from the plaque.
content.location: This is the most obvious straight crack that runs all the way to the top of the wall. It is between Photo-Op Arete and Prejudice.

content.description: Climb flakes and cracks ending about 13 yards upstream from the plaque.
content.location: Starts just right of the Pride crack. Follows the most apparent features of the face between Pride and Lichen Wall.

content.description: Start same as Take Five - traverse left and pull overhang at the crack to the left of the notch. Climb the left side of the wall.
content.location: Same as Take Five

content.description: Climb one of many variations of cracks, flakes, and small dihedrals on the lichen covered wall just left of the large chimney. Variations range from 5.4 to 5.7.
content.location: Lichen covered wall just left of Beginners Chimney, right of Prejudice. About 18 yards upstream from the plaque.

content.description: Climb up the ramp/dihedral. At the top of the ramp, the route trends to the right a little bit for the easy topout.
content.protection: hands or smaller for leading, trees for toprope anchors
content.location: Pretty much directly beneath the historical plaque thing.

content.description: Start 30 feet downstream from the plaque - climb the dihedral.
content.location: 30 feet downstream from the plaque

climbs.name: Go Directly to Jail - aka Photo-Op Arete

content.description: Just right of Ender. Climb the star-shaped incision, coming around the right side of the arete, and finish the climb up the face.
content.location: The prominent arete between Ender, which is about 5 yards upstream from the plaque, and Pride, the straight crack that reaches the top of the wall. Look for the star shaped incision at the bottom of the route for the start.

content.description: From the sloping ledge on Executioner's Song, pull the middle of the overhang and climb straight up over the bulge.
content.location: The sloping ledge on Executioner's Song.

content.description: This goes up the middle dihedral with a overhang at the top/   This 5.8 requires very good foot work and makes you think that 5.8 is hard.
content.location: Dihedrals

content.description: Start 15 feet upstream from the plaque and 5 feet right of the start of Layback Dihedral - climb a wandering route up the face following the incipient crack.
content.location: 15 feet upstream from the plaque and 5 feet right of the start of Layback Dihedral

content.description: Descent for downstream climbs in dihedral section
content.location: 45 feet downstream of the plaque

content.description: Start 35 yards upstream from the plaque, on a rock platform at the base of several dihedrals - climb right up ramp to the second right facing dihedral. Climb the dihedral to the upper ramp.   Note: The route is easier if the edge is used.
content.location: 35 Upstream of plaque

content.description: The gully is about 50 yards upstream from the plaque and just upstream from a low angle wall with and overhang along its base.
content.location: about 50 yards upstream from the plaque

content.description: Start 40 yards upstream from the plaque below a large right facing inside corner - from the sloping ledge, climb the corner to the top
content.location: About 40 yards upstream from the 'Mather Gorge' plaque.

content.description: Obvious chimney almost dead center in the Dihedrals area.
content.location: This is the large chimney/gully that divides the wall. top is about 20 yards upstream from the plaque.

content.description: Start same as Executioner's Song.  Climb the right face of Executioner's Song, using the arete to gain the ledge above.  Then continue up the arete above to the top.
content.protection: Trees at top for anchors.  Works well as a top belay.
content.location: Same start as Executioner's Song.

content.description: Start about ten feet left of Layback Dihedral and climb directly up the obvious arete.  Stay within the bounds and have fun. It only goes when it’s straight up, no detours. On Summer days bring oven mits!

The Dihedrals is a 70 yard long section of the cliff consisting mostly of dihedrals. The Dihedrals are about 75 yards upstream of Juliet's Balcony and beneath the plaque dedicating the gorge to Stephen T. Mather. This is one of the most popular spots at Great Falls. It is an excellent location for beginners and has several nice hard climbs too.
